question: How did the dynasty of NizamShahis of Ahmadnagar come to an end?
option1: Ahmadnagar was annexed into Mughal empire and Husain Shah was consigned to life imprisonment.
option2: Mughal troops destroyed Daulatabad fort and killed Nizam-ulMulk of Ahmadnagar.
option3: Fateh Khan usurped the throne from Nizam-ul Mulk.
option4: Malik Ambar was defeated in a battle with Mughals in 1631 and the entire royal family was killed by the Mughal troops.
answer: Ahmadnagar was annexed into Mughal empire and Husain Shah was consigned to life imprisonment.
explanation: After the death of Malik Ambar in May 1626, his son Fath Khan surrendered to the Mughals in 1633 and handed over the young Nizam Shahi ruler Hussain Shah, who was sent as a prisoner to the fort of Gwalior.
